name: Variance
description:
The variance of a random variable $X$ tells us how much the random variable $X$ "varies". We define it using expectation, and the variance of $X$ only exists if the expectation of $X$ exists. Variance is given as: $$\text{Var}[X]=\mathbb{E}[X^2] - \mathbb{E}[X]^2$$ Some basic properties of variance with a random variable $X$ and constant $a$:
 1. $\text{Var}(X + a) = \text{Var}(X)$
 2. $\text{Var}(aX) = a^2\text{Var}(X)$
 3. If random variables $X$ and $Y$ are uncorrelated, then we have $\text{Var}[X + Y] = \text{Var}[X] + \text{Var}[Y]$.
